40541.name: Abyssal Enforcer
40541.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to all other characters.
40541.flavorText: The Kabal print this on every package of illicit Mana Crystals: WARNING - DO NOT PUT WITHIN REACH OF ABYSSALS. THIS IS NOT APPROVED FOR USE BY FLAMING DEMONS OF ANY KIND.

40574.name: Alley Armorsmith
40574.text: Taunt Whenever this minion deals damage, gain that much Armor.
40574.flavorText: The rent is cheap and she passes the savings onto YOU!

40426.name: Alleycat
40426.flavorText: To be a cool cat in Gadgetzan, you gotta have bling.

40744.name: Ancient of Blossoms
40744.flavorText: His new shampoo is really working!

40605.name: Auctionmaster Beardo
40605.text: After you cast a spell, refresh your Hero Power.
40605.flavorText: Gadgetzan has always run an under-the-table auction house, and business has been PRETTY good for Beardo since the population explosion. And since the explosion that destroyed the competing auction houses in the city.

40596.name: Aya Blackpaw
40596.flavorText: Though young, Aya took over as the leader of Jade Lotus through her charisma and strategic acumen when her predecessor was accidentally crushed by a jade golem.

40931.name: Backroom Bouncer
40931.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
40931.flavorText: "WHY ARE YOU IN THE BACK ROOM? WHO IS WATCHING THE FRONT?!"

40492.name: Backstreet Leper
40492.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
40492.flavorText: Quit playing games with his heart. And his fingers. And foot. It's rude.

40494.name: Big-Time Racketeer
40494.flavorText: "It'd be a shame if someone disenchanted those Legendaries."

40957.name: Blastcrystal Potion
40957.text: Destroy a minion and one of your Mana Crystals.
40957.flavorText: There's a fine line between "potion" and "grenade". Wait. Actually, there's not.

40393.name: Bloodfury Potion
40393.text: Give a minion +3 Attack. If it's a Demon, also give it +3 Health.
40393.flavorText: You know what really makes my blood boil? The skyrocketing price of Bloodfury potions!

40493.name: Blowgill Sniper
40493.flavorText: Imagine how much further his darts would go if he had lungs instead of gills!

40294.name: Blubber Baron
40294.text: Whenever you summon a Battlecry minion while this is in your hand, gain +1/+1.
40294.flavorText: When oil, railroad, steel, robber, and red are all already taken, your options are limited.

40952.name: Bomb Squad
40952.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to an enemy minion. Deathrattle: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
40952.flavorText: Please don't explode! Please don't explode! Please don't explode!

40438.name: Brass Knuckles
40438.text: After your hero attacks, give a random minion in your hand +1/+1.
40438.flavorText: For the goon that wants to make a fashion statement.

40954.name: Burgly Bully
40954.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, add a Coin to your hand.
40954.flavorText: He only burgles to pay the bills. He is really just a bully at heart.

40419.name: Call in the Finishers
40419.flavorText: When you really need a job done… but you don't really care if it gets done right.

40404.name: Celestial Dreamer
40404.text: Battlecry: If you control a minion with 5 or more Attack, gain +2/+2.
40404.flavorText: If you think her job is easy, YOU try falling asleep on cue.

40437.name: Counterfeit Coin
40437.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
40437.flavorText: There is something funny about this coin… can't quite put my finger on it…

40988.name: Cryomancer
40988.flavorText: She loves Frozen. I mean who doesn't?

40391.name: Crystalweaver
40391.flavorText: The trick is soaking the crystals in warm milk to soften them up.

40741.name: Daring Reporter
40741.text: Whenever your opponent draws a card, gain +1/+1.
40741.flavorText: She's working on a story! While skydiving!

40745.name: Defias Cleaner
40745.flavorText: His house cleaning service is quite thorough. Not a spot to be found... or any of your stuff!

40694.name: Devolve
40694.text: Transform all enemy minions into random ones that cost (1) less.
40694.flavorText: Ragnaros looked down. He looked like some kind of War Golem. "WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO ME," he yelled. But all that came out was a deep grinding sound. He began to cry.

41567.name: Dirty Rat
41567.text: Taunt Battlecry: Your opponent summons a random minion from their hand.
41567.flavorText: It's not his fault… Someone keeps stealing his soap!

41126.name: Dispatch Kodo
41126.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack.
41126.flavorText: "Crime reported at First Bank of Gadgetzan. Huge quantities of Jade being carried away by what looks like a bunch of Hozen. Kodo 77 can you make it over there now?"

40703.name: Don Han'Cho
40703.text: Battlecry: Give a random minion in your hand +5/+5.
40703.flavorText: The brilliant mastermind of the Grimy Goons, Han sometimes thinks about ditching the idiot Cho, but that would just tear him apart.

40938.name: Dragonfire Potion
40938.text: Deal 5 damage to all minions except Dragons.
40938.flavorText: No one was brave enough to fire the dragon in person… so they made the potion do it.

40378.name: Drakonid Operative
40378.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, Discover a copy of a card in your opponent's deck.
40378.flavorText: His job is to spy on the Goons and the Jade Lotus, but he's OBVIOUSLY a dragon so it's pretty hard work.

40389.name: Fel Orc Soulfiend
40389.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to this minion.
40389.flavorText: "Doc says the persistent burning sensation in my soul is probably just an ulcer."

40517.name: Felfire Potion
40517.flavorText: Kazakus has a squad of imps bottling Felfire round-the-clock and he *still* can't keep up with demand.

40617.name: Fight Promoter
40617.text: Battlecry: If you control a minion with 6 or more Health, draw two cards.
40617.flavorText: "Yeah, I can get you Knuckles. No, no, he's been clean for *weeks*."

40803.name: Finja, the Flying Star
40803.text: Stealth Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, summon 2 Murlocs from your deck.
40803.flavorText: The last true master of Finjitsu.

40324.name: Freezing Potion
40324.flavorText: This is delicious! Oh no. BRAIN FREEEEEEEZE!

40914.name: Friendly Bartender
40914.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to your hero.
40914.flavorText: "What'll it be? A Jade Brew? A Grimy Goose? A Kabal Manatini?"

40696.name: Gadgetzan Ferryman
40696.text: Combo: Return a friendly minion to your hand.
40696.flavorText: Is it just me, or is there something fishy about that ferryman?

40949.name: Gadgetzan Socialite
40949.flavorText: Comment on her height, and she'll go from flapper to kneecapper in seconds flat.

40607.name: Genzo, the Shark
40607.text: Whenever this attacks, both players draw until they have 3 cards.
40607.flavorText: Infamous in the seedy underground card rooms of Gadgetzan, he got his nickname winning the coveted Shark Plushie in the city's first Hearthstone tournament.

40587.name: Getaway Kodo
40587.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to your hand.

40411.name: Greater Arcane Missiles
40411.text: Shoot three missiles at random enemies that deal 3 damage each.
40411.flavorText: Wow, and I thought Arcane Missiles was great!

40375.name: Greater Healing Potion
40375.text: Restore 12 Health to a friendly character.

40469.name: Grimestreet Enforcer
40469.text: At the end of your turn, give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
40469.flavorText: "Sir, you don't have a permit to park your mount here."

40474.name: Grimestreet Informant
40474.text: Battlecry: Discover a Hunter, Paladin, or Warrior card.
40474.flavorText: "Naw, naw. You're talkin' about Grime BOULEVARD. I ain't know nuthin' 'bout that."

40567.name: Grimestreet Outfitter
40567.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
40567.flavorText: If you bargain hard, he'll throw in the hat.

40569.name: Grimestreet Pawnbroker
40569.text: Battlecry: Give a random weapon in your hand +1/+1.
40569.flavorText: "I don't know a lot about used GvG cards, so I'm going to have to call in an expert."

40295.name: Grimestreet Protector
40295.flavorText: Some new asphalt should do the trick.

40743.name: Grimestreet Smuggler
40743.text: Battlecry: Give a random minion in your hand +1/+1.
40743.flavorText: She's got anything you want. Need the latest derpinger? No problem!

40531.name: Grimscale Chum
40531.text: Battlecry: Give a random Murloc in your hand +1/+1.
40531.flavorText: Listen, see? We'll take 'em to the docks, see? And throw 'em in the sea, see?

40568.name: Grimy Gadgeteer
40568.text: At the end of your turn, give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
40568.flavorText: "You look like a Gadgetgun 3000-Mark IV man, am I right?"

40951.name: Grook Fu Master
40951.flavorText: Grook Fu, the ancient Hozen art of bashing heads with a stick.

40339.name: Hidden Cache
40339.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
40339.flavorText: There is an urban legend that the first Toxic Sewer Ooze was born because a rookie Goon stashed an open container of milk in a Hidden Cache.

40911.name: Hired Gun
40911.flavorText: He loves his job and would do it for free! (But don't tell his boss!)

40482.name: Hobart Grapplehammer
40482.text: Battlecry: If you have a weapon equipped, give all minions in your hand and deck +2/+2.
40482.flavorText: Grapplehammer is the horrible mind behind the Automatic Piranha Launcher (banned in 7 districts)!

40344.name: Hozen Healer
40344.text: Battlecry: Restore a minion to full Health.
40344.flavorText: He didn't go to school for healing, but we keep losing all the good healers to Ratchet, so I guess we'll take him.

40839.name: I Know a Guy
40839.flavorText: Well… a guy who knows a guy.

40701.name: Inkmaster Solia
40701.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, the next spell you cast this turn costs (0).
40701.flavorText: Solia marks the Kabal with intricate tattoos that grant immense power. Also it makes it harder for other gangs to recruit from their numbers. BACK OFF, GOONS.

40797.name: Jade Behemoth
40797.flavorText: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

40523.name: Jade Blossom
40523.text: Summon a Jade Golem. Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
40523.flavorText: Meditating under a jade blossom is said to grant you wisdom, unless you have a pollen allergy.

40422.name: Jade Chieftain
40422.flavorText: Seeing his Jade Golem grow up into the tall, handsome 6/6 standing before him was the proudest moment of his life.

40372.name: Jade Idol
40372.text: Choose One - Summon a Jade Golem; or Shuffle 3 copies of this card into your deck.

40698.name: Jade Shuriken
40698.flavorText: Good news is, after you remove it from your wound, you can use it to pay your medical bills!

40527.name: Jade Spirit
40527.flavorText: "He's so cute! I just want to squeeze him, then use him for Jade Golem parts!" - Aya Blackpaw

40697.name: Jade Swarmer
40697.flavorText: He's so good at swarming, he can swarm all by himself!

40285.name: Jinyu Waterspeaker
40285.flavorText: Waterspeakers can tell the future! So the Jade Lotus employs them to speculate on the Auction House.

40407.name: Kabal Chemist
40407.text: Battlecry: Add a random Potion to your hand.
40407.flavorText: Sure you could have that Polymorph potion, but wouldn't you rather have this mystery potion? It could be anything. Even a Polymorph potion!

40496.name: Kabal Courier
40496.text: Battlecry: Discover a Mage, Priest, or Warlock card.
40496.flavorText: Hey, you park your kodo under a harpy nest, you get what you deserve.

40583.name: Kabal Crystal Runner
40583.text: Costs (2) less for each Secret you've played this game.
40583.flavorText: "Listen, I can cut you in on a little of this premium mana, but you can't tell my boss."

40299.name: Kabal Lackey
40299.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (1).
40299.flavorText: I'll tell you one thing he doesn't lack: GUMPTION.

40929.name: Kabal Songstealer
40929.flavorText: Gadgetzan Writer’s Award goes to the player who writes the most compelling fanfic about why this Arakkoa has a golden frog in his hand!

40432.name: Kabal Talonpriest
40432.flavorText: Inkmaster Solia had to figure out how to tattoo feathers.

40940.name: Kabal Trafficker
40940.text: At the end of your turn, add a random Demon to your hand.
40940.flavorText: She ships illicit mana crystals around the world in packages marked: FUNNEL CAKE.

40408.name: Kazakus
40408.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, create a custom spell.
40408.flavorText: The mysterious leader of the Kabal is NOT a dragon, and does NOT deal in illegal potions. Any public statements to the contrary will be met with litigation and Dragonfire Potions.

40678.name: Knuckles
40678.text: After this attacks a minion, it also hits the enemy hero.
40678.flavorText: When confronted with accusations of performance-enhancing bananas, Knuckles replied, "I get my fruit from trees I knock down with my bare hands like everyone else."

40289.name: Kooky Chemist
40289.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.

40537.name: Krul the Unshackled
40537.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, summon all Demons from your hand.
40537.flavorText: Spicklefizz pondered his life choices as he looked at the chain around his neck. "Become a warlock," they said. "You get to enslave demons," they said.

40416.name: Kun the Forgotten King
40416.text: Choose One - Gain 10 Armor; or Refresh your Mana Crystals.
40416.flavorText: Aya siphons a bit of Kun's soul to animate each golem in her Jade army. To his credit, he's being a great sport about it.

40613.name: Leatherclad Hogleader
40613.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand, gain Charge.
40613.flavorText: The Hogchoppers, the terrors of Tanaris, can always be found at one tavern or another in Gadgetzan, refueling for totally real and legit adventures that they go on.

40742.name: Lotus Agents
40742.text: Battlecry: Discover a Druid, Rogue, or Shaman card.
40742.flavorText: Mostly, they stand around and look cool.

40441.name: Lotus Assassin
40441.text: Stealth. Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain Stealth.
40441.flavorText: For 5000g, you can just give the Jade Lotus any name and they will assassinate and/or embarrass them.

40693.name: Lotus Illusionist
40693.text: After this minion attacks a hero, transform it into a random 6-Cost minion.
40693.flavorText: If you think her Xavius and Sylvanas cosplay is great, wait till you see her Reno Jackson!

40791.name: Luckydo Buccaneer
40791.text: Battlecry: If your weapon has at least 3 Attack, gain +4/+4.
40791.flavorText: You can't just leave a Luckydo somewhere. You gotta keep 'em with you! Especially in Gadgetzan!

40615.name: Lunar Visions
40615.text: Draw 2 cards. Minions drawn cost (2) less.
40615.flavorText: The true mystery of lunar visions is how there is nothing to watch when there are so many channels.

41841.name: Madam Goya
41841.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Summon any copies of it in your deck.
41841.flavorText: She has set up her Black Market here in Gadgetzan for one purpose, to make a KILLING when Beanie Babies make their inevitable comeback.

40381.name: Mana Geode
40381.flavorText: Gadgetzan, where even the pet rocks have pet rocks.

40935.name: Manic Soulcaster
40935.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Shuffle a copy into your deck.
40935.flavorText: When casting a tournament, you really have to put your soul into it!

40397.name: Mark of the Lotus
40397.flavorText: The mark of the Lotus is a little flower drawn in permanent marker on the ankle.

40955.name: Mayor Noggenfogger
40955.flavorText: This flavor text was randomly generated. If it happens to form words and make sense, that is purely by chance.

40577.name: Meanstreet Marshal
40577.text: Deathrattle: If this minion has 2 or more Attack, draw a card.
40577.flavorText: Remember, submit your bribes directly to the Marshal - it's the law!

41566.name: Mistress of Mixtures
41566.flavorText: Her favorite mixture is cola and lime.

40889.name: Naga Corsair
40889.flavorText: Hook-tails are nice and all but she keeps getting stuck on things.

40465.name: Patches the Pirate
40465.text: After you play a Pirate, summon this minion from your deck.
40465.flavorText: What do sailors yell when Patches steals their treasure chest full of laws and other things being transported to parliament for a vote? "The Eyes have it!"

40401.name: Pilfered Power
40401.text: Gain an empty Mana Crystal for each friendly minion.
40401.flavorText: The Hozen don't get paid much, but at least they get to keep any excess mana.

40936.name: Pint-Size Potion
40936.text: Give all enemy minions -3 Attack this turn only.
40936.flavorText: I hope you didn't disenchant your Shadow Word: Horror!

40683.name: Piranha Launcher
40683.text: After your hero attacks, summon a 1/1 Piranha.
40683.flavorText: A great improvement over the guppy launcher.

40373.name: Potion of Madness
40373.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 2 or less Attack until end of turn.
40373.flavorText: You'd be insane NOT to drink it!

40409.name: Potion of Polymorph
40409.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, transform it into a 1/1 Sheep.

40364.name: Public Defender
40364.flavorText: Happy to defend any public offender!

40428.name: Rat Pack
40428.text: Deathrattle: Summon a number of 1/1 Rats equal to this minion's Attack.
40428.flavorText: He's gonna do it his way.

40323.name: Raza the Chained
40323.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, your Hero Power costs (0) this game.
40323.flavorText: "Could you do me a favor and get the keys from Kazakus?"

40281.name: Red Mana Wyrm
40281.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack.
40281.flavorText: It has double the Attack. "Go on." And double the Health. "Yes??" And its trigger has twice the effect. "WHAT???" And it costs… Five times more.

40691.name: Seadevil Stinger
40691.text: Battlecry: The next Murloc you play this turn costs Health instead of Mana.
40691.flavorText: Pretty harmless unless you're a Seadevil.

40906.name: Second-Rate Bruiser
40906.text: Taunt Costs (2) less if your opponent has at least three minions.
40906.flavorText: He'll be a first-rate bruiser once he gets used to his contacts.

41118.name: Sergeant Sally
41118.text: Deathrattle: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack to all enemy minions.
41118.flavorText: "Who is she? Where did she come from? We don't even have a police force here in Gadgetzan!!" - Mayor Noggenfogger

40695.name: Shadow Sensei
40695.flavorText: He used to be Aya's tutor, but she fired him for bugging her too much.

40905.name: Shaku, the Collector
40905.text: Stealth. Whenever this attacks, add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
40905.flavorText: Aya even staged an intervention once, but Shaku still insists that he is not a hoarder.

40681.name: Shaky Zipgunner
40681.text: Deathrattle: Give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
40681.flavorText: The Grimy Goons can get you any weapon you want but if you want it to not explode you gotta pay extra.

41414.name: Sleep with the Fishes
41414.text: Deal 3 damage to all damaged minions.
41414.flavorText: If you're sleeping with the fishes, we highly suggest not bringing an electric blanket.

40608.name: Small-Time Buccaneer
40608.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a weapon equipped.
40608.flavorText: "Oh, I'm not serious about it. I only pirate on the weekends."

40634.name: Small-Time Recruits
40634.text: Draw three 1-Cost minions from your deck.
40634.flavorText: Now we know why they wear tiny watches.

40679.name: Smuggler's Crate
40679.text: Give a random Beast in your hand +2/+2.
40679.flavorText: Are you sure these are the crates that are supposed to go to the Gadgetzan petting zoo?

40371.name: Smuggler's Run
40371.text: Give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
40371.flavorText: One of the most famous busts in Gadgetzan’s history happened on Smuggler’s Run, where Sergeant Sally apprehended a cadre of Grimy Goons transporting a massive number of illegal fish heads.

40700.name: Spiked Hogrider
40700.text: Battlecry: If an enemy minion has Taunt, gain Charge.
40700.flavorText: Did you know the Hogchoppers compete every year at the Mirage Raceway? They do. It's a real group.

40566.name: Stolen Goods
40566.flavorText: It fell off a kodo, I promise!

40213.name: Street Trickster
40213.flavorText: His first trick: making your wallet disappear!

40928.name: Streetwise Investigator
40928.flavorText: "Hmmmm… Call it a hunch, but I'm starting to think that there may be some kind of criminal activity going on in Gadgetzan."

40611.name: Tanaris Hogchopper
40611.text: Battlecry: If your opponent's hand is empty, gain Charge.
40611.flavorText: The Hogchoppers are well-known throughout Kalimdor for being a real, actual group.

40921.name: Toxic Sewer Ooze
40921.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
40921.flavorText: When Sergeant Sally shows up unexpectedly, DO NOT FLUSH YOUR MANA CRYSTALS DOWN THE TOILET.

40684.name: Trogg Beastrager
40684.text: Battlecry: Give a random Beast in your hand +1/+1.
40684.flavorText: Still angry that the Gadgetzan Rager Club wouldn't accept him as a member.

40598.name: Unlicensed Apothecary
40598.text: After you summon a minion, deal 5 damage to your hero.
40598.flavorText: Get the ingredients wrong on ONE healing potion and they take your license. What a world!

40297.name: Volcanic Potion
40297.flavorText: The secret ingredient in Kazakus's award-winning chili recipe.

40549.name: Weasel Tunneler
40549.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your opponent's deck.
40549.flavorText: He's the reason the First Bank of Gadgetzan has steel floors.

40486.name: White Eyes
40486.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Shuffle 'The Storm Guardian' into your deck.

40636.name: Wickerflame Burnbristle
40636.flavorText: Wickerflame spent years as a recruit for the Goons, never making the big-time because he always fired his chest-cannon too slowly. "Hey," he thought, "maybe if I keep my beard lit on fire, I can do this faster." BOOM, promoted.

40337.name: Wind-up Burglebot
40337.text: Whenever this attacks a minion and survives, draw a card.
40337.flavorText: Don't blame the bot for his crimes... Blame whoever keeps winding him up!

40950.name: Worgen Greaser
40950.flavorText: Hair products are 79% of his monthly budget.

40603.name: Wrathion
40603.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Draw cards until you draw one that isn't a Dragon.
40603.flavorText: Wrathion, son of Deathwing, is a dragon. Why isn't he tagged as a dragon, you ask? WHAT, ARE YOU TRYING TO BLOW HIS COVER??
